newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Sticks and stones breaks Colombia rebel attack.
newsitem.headline: Sticks and stones breaks Colombia rebel attack.

text.p: Villagers using sticks, stones and single-shot rifles fought off one of Colombia's fiercest rebel armies on Wednesday, authorities said.

Inhabitants of Beriguado, a town in northwest Choco province, killed two heavily-armed National Liberation Army (ELN) rebels and forced the rest of a guerrilla raiding party to flee, a police spokesman said.
The ELN, set up by radical Roman Catholic priests in 1966, is Colombia's second largest rebel force and has inflicted a series of humiliating defeats on the army in recent weeks.
ELN guerrillas brought down a helicopter carrying 20 soldiers this month in northeastern Colombia and killed 10 soldiers in an ambush four days later.
